DOC.brief_summary: Describe and characterizes laparoscopic postherniotomy patients with persistent moderate/severe pain affecting every day activities - including detailed quantitative sensory assessment
DOC.brief_title: Persistent Pain After Laparoscopic Inguinal Hernia Repair
DOC.criteria: Male patients > 18 yrs No sign of hernia recurrence Chronic groin pain lasting more than 3 months Moderate/severe pain related impairment of everyday activities Other causes of persistent pain in groin region (hip, other surgical procedures) Drug or alcohol abuse Conflicting neurological disorders
DOC.keyword: Postherniotomy Pain after laparoscopic inguinal herniotomy
